thoughts: I recently finished James Wallace's book, "Hard Drive." I thought of recommending it, and there is no better place than here (though it's sad that the site doesn't have permalink capability). The book covers Bill Gates' life until 1992. One of the reasons I liked this book the most is because it explores the nerdy side of Bill Gates and how he was also lost in his life in the early days of Microsoft, rather than depicting him as a boy who knew his way.
